subtitle: An unusual recipe but it looks stunning and tastes just as good as it looks.

method.text: Place the flour in a large bowl and mix in the salt and yeast. Measure out 300 g / 11oz of the mixture into a separate bowl and add to this the oregano.

Blend together 150 ml / 5 fl oz of the warm water with the tomato puree, 4 tbsp olive oil and red pepper puree. Add this mixture to the herb mixture stirring well to form a soft dough. Knead the dough on an unfloured surface for 2-3 minutes or until smooth. Wrap in cling film and set aside.
In the other bowl of flour stir all but <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> tablespoon of the cheese and the remaining water and oil, to form a dough. Knead on a lightly floured surface for 2-3 min.

Roll out the cheese dough into a large circle about 5mm / <sup>1</sup>/<sub>1</sub>0 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> cm thick. Then roll out the pepper dough into a circle so it is slightly smaller than the cheese dough. Lay the tomato dough on top of the cheese dough and roll them up like a Swiss roll.

Place the roll on a large greased baking tray, seam side down and tuck the ends under. Brush the top with olive oil and sprinkle over the reserved cheese. Cover with greased cling film and leave to prove for 1hr 30 min - 2 hrs or until the dough has doubled in size.
Reduce oven temperature to 200°C and bake for a further 20-25 min. Cool the loaf on a wire rack. Eat while warm or slice and toast.

title: Cheese and pepper swirl loaf
